title: See wild way bar is separating people
description: People and businesses around the world are getting creative to try to safely socialize. CNN asked a health expert to weigh in on how safe these methods really are.

title: How Russia descended into pandemic hell
description: Russia's Covid-19 cases have jumped after previously saying they had the virus under control. Now, they are turning to the global community for help. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

title: Woman wins Picasso worth more than $1 million in fundraising raffle
description: An Italian woman won a Picasso painting worth 1 million euros ($1.1 million) in a fundraising raffle overseen by auction house Christie's in Paris on Wednesday.

title: Family finds nearly $1 million in road
description: A Virginia family discovered two bags containing nearly $1 million in cash while on an afternoon drive.

title: Nurse shares selfies before and after virus
description: A San Francisco nurse who contracted Covid-19 shared pictures of himself showing the impact the virus had on his body.

title: A Ford factory reopened on Monday. By Tuesday, Covid-19 shut it down again
description: Just days after reopening its American assembly plants, Ford temporarily shut down two separate factories because employees tested positive for Covid-19.

title: These before and after images show how much a Michigan dam failure drained a lake
description: Videos and images captured by witnesses show just how much water was unleashed when Michigan's Edenville Dam failed.

title: India and Bangladesh's cyclone evacuations complicated by coronavirus
description: Cyclone evacuation efforts in India and Bangladesh are being complicated by the coronavirus pandemic, as relief teams grapple with how to get millions of people to safety while also protecting them against the risk of Covid-19.

title: From footballer to Netflix superstar: How Jesus Mosquera became one of Spain's top actors
description: Hugo Beltran has been on screen for less than two minutes but already he's down to only some skimpy underwear, his chiseled abs rippling as he gyrates on stage for scores of delighted women.

title: NASA's head of human spaceflight abruptly resigns, citing 'mistake'
description: NASA's chief of human spaceflight, Doug Loverro, is departing the space agency after just six months in the role. In a farewell note to colleagues, which was obtained by reporters on Tuesday, Loverro said he was resigning over a "mistake" he had made earlier this year.

title: White House looking for someone to blame, and CDC chief might be it, sources say
description: A day after President Donald Trump privately excoriated the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to Republican senators during a lunch on Capitol Hill, the fate of the agency's director, Dr. Robert Redfield, is in question.

title: Body of 39-year-old former WWE star found on California beach
description: The body of former WWE star Shad Gaspard was found on a California beach early Wednesday morning, three days after he went missing during a swim.

title: Tiffany Trump graduates from law school
description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday tweeted his congratulations to Tiffany Trump, the fourth of his five children, in support of her graduation from law school. Tiffany Trump took part in virtual commencement ceremonies, along with the rest of the class of 2020, from Georgetown Law School on Saturday.

title: Trump will lose in a landslide because of the economy, new election model predicts
description: • Cuomo: This Trump quote says everything you need to know

title: Trump will lose in 'historic' landslide because of US economy, election model predicts
Blank Dead Sea Scroll fragments actually contain text invisible to the naked eye
description: For decades, fragments from the ancient Dead Sea Scrolls were stowed away at the University of Manchester, deemed largely worthless.

title: Another Disney heir slams the company's business practices
description: Another heir of Walt Disney is publicly expressing disgust with the company his grandfather founded for furloughing thousands of workers while continuing to pay its executives millions of dollars and massive bonuses.

title: New York subway launches UV light program in effort to kill Covid-19
description: The agency in charge of public transit in New York City announced a pilot program using ultraviolet light lamps to kill Covid-19 on buses and trains and at stations.

title: Pandemic could force 60M more people to live on less than $2 a day, World Bank says
description: The coronavirus pandemic could push as many as 60 million people into extreme poverty, the World Bank said on Tuesday.

title: State police search home of suspects in Ahmaud Arbery's killing
description: The Georgia Bureau of Investigation searched the home of two men charged in the death of Ahmaud Arbery, the agency said.

title: CDC officials: White House decisions worsening pandemic effects
Female Fortune 500 CEOs reach an all-time high, but it's still a small percentage
description: The number of women running Fortune 500 companies has hit an all-time record of 37.

title: Nicole Kidman broke her ankle 'running around the neighborhood,' according to Keith Urban
description: According to Keith Urban there has not been much dancing with wife, Nicole Kidman, around their house recently.

title: All states partially reopen
At least 12 people have died during Cyclone Amphan
description:
• Cyclone tracks for Kolkata
• In pictures: Cyclone bears down on millions

title: Pregnant women in Madagascar get free transport to hospitals during coronavirus pandemic
description: Raholimalala Avotiana is rocking her newborn baby boy to sleep. It's her fourth day at the Maternity Hospital of Befelatanana in Antananarivo, Madagascar's capital.

title: 'The Batman' actor Charlie Carver talks feeling 'unsafe' at school for being gay
description: Charlie Carver, who appears in the upcoming "The Batman" film, revealed in a speech that he felt unsafe in school growing up because he is gay and many kids weren't so understanding.

title: Doctor studying recovering patients makes unexpected find
description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta discusses the potential long-term effects Covid-19 could have on the lungs based on past coronavirus outbreaks.

title: Barr met with prosecutor now reviewing Russia probe immediately after Mueller investigation ended
description: Almost immediately after special counsel Robert Mueller closed his investigation last year, Attorney General William Barr was huddling with the prosecutor he assigned to re-examine the Russia probe -- in a series of meetings that haven't been previously known and appear to highlight Barr's drive to rewrite the legacy of the Mueller investigation.

title: They bought a $1 house in Italy, then Covid-19 struck
description: When Italian towns began offering houses for sale for little more than $1, they inspired legions of dreamers to take a gamble on moving to a remote corner of Italy.

title: This company made aircraft parts. Now it's making N95 masks
description: In the UAE, Mubadala Aerospace is shifting its operations from airplane parts to surgical masks. They expect nearly a billion orders for N95 masks over the next five years. CNN's John Defterios reports.

title: Oil prices are recovering. Is it too much, too fast?
description: What a difference a month makes. Oil prices — after dropping to historic lows in April — have moved away from the cliff edge, pushing higher as demand for energy picks up, more producers keep crude in the ground and concerns about insufficient storage ease.

title: Matt Lauer responds to rape allegation from Ronan Farrow's 'Catch & Kill'
description: Matt Lauer had been looking for an opportune time to publish a piece responding to Ronan Farrow's "Catch & Kill," which contained a rape allegation that he denied. In the wake of Ben Smith's New York Times column scrutinizing Farrow's work, he went ahead.

title: Pizza maker delivers response to Michael Jordan's 'Flu Game'
description: Among Michael Jordan's seemingly infinite list of great moments, "The Flu Game" in the 1997 NBA Finals against the Utah Jazz is close to the top.

title: This Tokyo pub has a machine that sprays customers with disinfectant as they enter
description: As businesses around the world adopt new practices due to coronavirus, one Japanese pub is taking a novel approach to customer safety.

title: Astronomers spot 'twist' evidence of a baby planet in a young star system
description: A spiral marks the spot where a baby planet is forming around a star in a young system 520 light-years from Earth in the Auriga constellation. The planet birth is visible in new images and observations made by astronomers using the European Southern Observatory's Very Large Telescope in Chile.

title: Runner completes 19 marathons in 19 days for coronavirus relief
description: A runner from the Isle of Man has gone the distance -- and beyond -- to raise money for coronavirus relief.

title: A mink may have infected a human with Covid-19, Dutch authorities believe
description: Dutch authorities believe a mink may have infected a human with Covid-19, and are instituting mandatory testing at all mink farms in the Netherlands.

title: A boy chosen as the Panchen Lama disappeared in 1995. China says he's now a college grad with a job
description: Twenty-five years ago, a six-year-old boy was recognized as the reincarnation of the Panchen Lama, the second-highest ranking figure in Tibetan Buddhism. He promptly disappeared.

title: Rolls-Royce is cutting at least 9,000 jobs as the coronavirus slams aviation
description: Aircraft engine maker Rolls-Royce is cutting at least 9,000 jobs because of the collapse in demand for air travel caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: The US President will say something else outlandish, false or ridiculous soon, as the list of things he wants everyone to ignore grows
description: Here's a bold prediction: President Donald Trump is going to say something either totally outlandish, verifiably false or completely ridiculous soon.

title: How Asia's richest man is trying to build the next global tech giant
description: Mukesh Ambani wants to build the next global technology company. And if he plays his cards right, his mobile carrier and technology juggernaut JioPlatforms could soon hold rank alongside the likes of Google, Amazon, Alibaba and Tencent.

title: New details emerge on Reade's exit from Biden's office
description: New details emerge from a former coworker about why Tara Reade may have left Joe Biden's Senate office in 1993. CNN's MJ Lee reports conflicting accounts further complicate Reade's allegation against the former Vice President.

title: The foolish mistake that put an end to my travels
description: Every time I read a news story about a young traveler in hospital in Thailand struggling to get home following a horrible motorbike accident, my stomach twists into a knot.

title: CNN anchor wants you to hear this quote from Trump
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo argues that President Trump doesn't like coronavirus testing, tracing or masks because they may make people "less pumped to reopen recklessly."

title: How sharing dinner table items can make you sick
description: CNN's Randi Kaye takes a closer look at how quickly germs can spread in restaurants through a science experiment designed to track germ droplets.

title: Church cancels mass indefinitely following death of priest
description: A church in Houston has canceled mass indefinitely after one of its priests died and five others tested positive for the coronavirus.
